### Vaginal microbiota dataset: Valencia

Valencia is a vaginal microbiota "classifier" (more on this later) developed by Michael France (Ravel's lab).

![](images/Valencia.png){fig-align="center" width="400px"} 

:warning: Add reference 

https://github.com/ravel-lab/VALENCIA

https://microbiomejournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s40168-020-00934-6


France, M.T., Ma, B., Gajer, P. et al. VALENCIA: a nearest centroid classification method for vaginal microbial communities based on composition. Microbiome 8, 166 (2020). https://doi.org/10.1186/s40168-020-00934-6

. . .

To build their classifier, they also curated a large dataset of microbiota samples from several cohorts.

This data is available on Valencia's GitHub repository as `csv` files.

:warning: Add link

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

valencia_counts_raw <- read_csv(file = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ravel-lab/VALENCIA/refs/heads/master/Publication_materials/Data_and_metadata/all_samples_taxonomic_composition_data.csv")
valencia_metadata_raw <- read_csv(file = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ravel-lab/VALENCIA/refs/heads/master/Publication_materials/Data_and_metadata/all_samples_metadata.csv")

```

After some formating (creation of a `SummarizedExperiment` object), we can use this data.
